name: Qamaits at the dawn of time
description:
*Half of all proceeds from this auction will go to supporting Native American Indian First Nations. You can also donate directly here: https://www.firstnations.org/fndi_donate/ 

Qamaits, the World Mother and Warrior Goddess of the Nuxalk — the Bella Coola First Nations people of Canada) — rules Death and Beginnings. In the beginning the giants of the mountains were so high that nothing could survive on them, and Qamaits defeated them, knocking them down in battle so they became the mountain landscapes that they are today. Sometimes her pet snake Sisiutl attacks humans and causes disasters, which are portents of her coming. 

**This auratic iconographic portrait was modelled on ceremonial robes and headdresses from the Nuxalk people, as well as surviving photographs of Nuxalk and Haida women and girls from the turn of the century.
